speaker: BOY
line: Thanks, mister. I'll mail it right off.

speaker: BOY
line: "Federal Bureau of Investigation?"

speaker: TAG LINE
line: RESIST OR SERVE

speaker: CHOPPER PILOT
line: Heli-Unit Four responding to Ruskin Dam. We have numerous bodies. Repeat, numerous bodies. We're coming in for a closer look. It looks like some kind of incineration has occurred here. We're looking for survivors. Recommend we get emergency response up here on the double. We'll need medivac and triage facilities. Contact state and federal authorities for possible medical quarantine.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: Was she here? Is she here?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, and medics are all over her.

speaker: MULDER
line: She's alive?

speaker: SKINNER
line: They're working on her now. Come on.

speaker: SKINNER
line: An SAR chopper pilot found her huddled in the woods this morning with about fifty other survivors. She has minor burns, but her fluids and electrolytes were abnormally depleted.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: AIDE
line: She's in vasogenic shock. Unless you gents are doctors, you're in the way. This woman needs to get to a hospital. On three - one... two... three.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What happened here, Agent Mulder?!

speaker: MULDER
line: The answer just got loaded onto that chopper!

speaker: SPENDER
line: Can I talk to you, please? Is she here? Was she found?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: My mother.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I'm fairly certain it's not a question of dosage. We've administered three intramuscular injections over the past twenty hours, since we found her on the roadside.

speaker: WMM
line: And you've seen no effect?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: No. It doesn't look good. At all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mmmmm... what time is it?

speaker: MULDER
line: What time is it? It's time to thank your lucky stars.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are you laughing?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not laughing at you. I'm just very happy to be standing here talking to you, that's all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what am I doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: You were airlifted here in vasogenic shock.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From what?

speaker: MULDER
line: You've got some first-degree burns and scorching on your hands and face.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From what?

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't remember?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: Is any of this coming back to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doing what?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was hoping you were going to answer that question for me.

speaker: NURSE
line: You shouldn't be elevated, Miss Scully, not until we get your blood pressure back. She really needs her rest.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll come back.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Mulder...

speaker: SPENDER
line: They didn't find her. She wasn't among the victims. They only found her wheelchair.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What were you doing with her?

speaker: MULDER
line: What was I doing with her? What makes you think we have anything to do with this?

speaker: SPENDER
line: My mom's a cripple. She hasn't driven a car for... I don't know how long. They found her wheelchair a hundred and thirty miles from the hospital, where I'm now told Agent Scully was meeting with her prior -

speaker: MULDER
line: Look -

speaker: SPENDER
line: No, you look! She's my mother. She's not some test subject of yours.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your mother will be found.

speaker: SPENDER
line: All I want is for you to leave it alone. Is that too much to ask?

speaker: WMM
line: You're probably thirsty.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Remind me to complain to the captain about the service.

speaker: WMM
line: You may have that opportunity. This ship is bound back to Vladivostok tomorrow. I gather there'll be quite an enthusiastic homecoming.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Do you have the boy?

speaker: WMM
line: No. Ms. Covarrubias took him. Your alliance with her was as misguided as ours, but it appears she was unaware of the consequences of her deception. You were clever. Infect the boy to ensure infection of anyone who tried to learn what he knows, who would cheat you.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Then where's the boy?

speaker: WMM
line: Dead. Victim of another mysterious holocaust. Unable now to tell what he knew or saw.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Then you got no choice but to deal with me.

speaker: WMM
line: I'm afraid there's no deal to be made.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'm the only one who knows what those incidents are. What they mean. I know what that boy saw.

speaker: WMM
line: You've as much as told me what I need to know.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You know nothing.

speaker: WMM
line: If the boy was your trump card why infect him unless you could also cure him with a vaccine developed by the Russians? One that works. It would mean that the resistance to the alien colonists is now possible.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You're dreaming.

speaker: WMM
line: Do you have the vaccine?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You need what I know.

speaker: WMM
line: Do you have the vaccine?!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Give you the means to save Covarrubias after what she did?

speaker: WMM
line: The means to save yourself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know what to say. I mean, I - I don't have the first clue. There's nothing here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, at least you're not alone. None of the other survivors have been able to give a cogent account, either.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I have never been here. I couldn't tell you how to get here, let alone drive it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you remember when you last saw Cassandra Spender?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was there, too?

speaker: MULDER
line: I ran more x-rays. I haven't told anybody yet what I found, though.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You found more implants?

speaker: MULDER
line: That would explain how you were directed to the site, and why you can't remember. It would explain the sensation Cassandra Spender was describing, her abduction fantasies. It would explain Skyland Mountain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but it wouldn't explain why they would want to kill me. And it doesn't explain why I survived.

speaker: MULDER
line: It all comes down to a question, Scully. One that hasn't been answered or I don't even think honestly addressed. Who made that chip in your neck? That chip was found in a military research facility. Our government made that chip, implanted it in your neck as part of a secret military project to develop a biochemical weapon, to monitor your immunity, or to destroy you like a lab rat, if the truth were to be exposed. Your cancer... your cure... everything that's happening to you now - it all points to that chip. The truth I've been searching for? That truth is in you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, when I met you five years ago, you told me that your sister had been abducted... by aliens. That that event had marked you so deeply, that nothing else mattered. I didn't believe you, but I followed you, on nothing more than your faith that the truth was out there, based not on facts, not on science, but on your memories that your sister had been taken from you. Your memories were all that you had.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't trust those memories now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, whether you trust them or not, they've led you here. And me. But I have no memories to either trust nor distrust, and if you ask me now to follow you again, to stand behind you in what you now believe, without knowing what happened to me out there, without those memories, I can't. I won't.

speaker: MULDER
line: If I could give you those memories, if I could prove that I was right and that what I believed for so long was wrong...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what you really want?

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: The facial scarrings appear to be self-mutilation done as protection.

speaker: THIRD ELDER
line: Protection against what?

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: Infection by the black oil. He was the lone survivor of a crashed spacecraft at a military base in West Virginia.

speaker: THIRD ELDER
line: What the hell is he?

speaker: WMM
line: An alien rebel. This is what the boy saw in Russia. The last face the dead saw at Skyland Mountain, and most surely who killed our man at the dam in Pennsylvania. He's a resistance fighter against the alien colonists. This is what Alex Krycek knew - that a war had begun.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: What good was that knowledge? Without the vaccine against the black oil, no one can survive.

speaker: WMM
line: We have a vaccine. Developed by the Russians, stolen by Krycek, given to me.

speaker: WMM
line: Do you see what this means? Resistance is possible. We have the weapons and the magic in hand.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: We don't know the vaccine works.

speaker: WMM
line: It will. And if it doesn't, we have a new alliance to be made.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: Side with the resistance?

speaker: THIRD ELDER
line: Suicide.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: They'll squash us as they do them. We must turn the rebel over.

speaker: WMM
line: But first, wait till we know the vaccine works.

speaker: WERBER
line: Hi, Dana. It's nice to meet you again. Are you okay with this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm okay.

speaker: WERBER
line: There are a few things I want to say I didn't touch on over the phone. I'm sure Agent Mulder told you about how this works. Have you ever been hypnotized?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, once... but I have to be honest with you, I didn't have much luck.

speaker: WERBER
line: Well, I hope we can do better today. I'm going to be using something a little different. You may have heard of hypnogogic trance, which is just a light trance state where we relax some of the filtering processes. Okay?

speaker: WERBER
line: I'm going to ask you to go back to the place we talked about on the phone. Just close your eyes and take long, deep breaths, relaxing all parts of your body. Long, deep breaths. Relaxing your hands and your feet. Relaxing your jaw, your pelvis. Long, deep breaths. Back to the "night place."

speaker: SCULLY (V.O.)
line: I don't think this is working.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God! Oh, my God!

speaker: WERBER
line: Where are you, Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh... I'm, uh... I'm with the others.

speaker: WERBER
line: Are you in the "night place"?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And then... and then it was gone. Oh, oh!

speaker: WERBER
line: What is it, Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's, uh... they're back.

speaker: WERBER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, they're... they're on fire!

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're setting them on fire. I can't...

speaker: WERBER
line: Who? Who's doing this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Their faces, I... they have no faces. I... they have no eyes. Oh, God! They're coming at us!

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're surrounding us! They won't stop! They won't stop! There's... there's another one. There's another ship.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They see it. They were attacking them.

speaker: WERBER
line: Who were they attacking, Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The... the faceless men. They're... oh, my God, I can't -

speaker: WERBER
line: Do you want to stop Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Now it's coming at us. Oh, my God! No! Cassandra!

speaker: WERBER
line: Where's Cassandra?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They're... they're taking her. They're... oh, my God.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't...

speaker: WERBER
line: Dana? Dana, I'm going to stop now. I want you to open your eyes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I...

speaker: WERBER
line: I want you to open your eyes, Dana, and come on back. Dana, I want you to open your eyes and come on back to us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've been here the whole time?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I, uh, reviewed the tape of the session as you requested. I have to say, I wasn't prepared for what I heard on this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir. Neither was I.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm familiar with the regression process and Dr. Werber's work. I've heard hundreds of those types of abduction scenarios.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well what do you make of this one?

speaker: MULDER
line: The imagery is startling, but not atypical: bright lights, weightlessness, stolen memory, lost time expressed as a close encounter, an abduction, religious rapture as a kind of dark night of the soul.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Expressed?

speaker: MULDER
line: Described and then interpreted into a linear narrative, a, uh, gestalt impression of a subjective, nonlinear experience.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And your interpretation?

speaker: MULDER
line: That Agent Scully witnessed a very powerful event. Not unlike the one I described on my regression tape of the false memory of my sister's abduction.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've listened to the tape several times, and I don't have a clear recollection of what I hear myself saying, but I also don't see any reason why I'd be saying it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I've got a problem. And the problem is, I have to head up the investigation into this incident. I don't have the luxury of interpretation. I have to make a report, and that report must state a reason or cite a fact, or at least make an assumption. As I sit here right now, I'm unable to do that. I need to know what happened.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was staged.

speaker: MULDER
line: To test a classified military project, or to cover it up.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then wha - I wanna know what happened to Cassandra Spender.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cassandra Spender was taken aboard a military aircraft, as part of the staging.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Over the past five years I've doubted you, only to be persuaded by the power of your belief in extraterrestrial phenomena, and I'm doubting you now, not because of that belief, but because extraterrestrial phenomena is frankly the more plausible explanation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then I suggest you put that in your report.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: The vaccine has no effect.

speaker: WMM
line: We must give it time.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: We must survive first. Survival means collaboration.

speaker: WMM
line: Turn over the alien rebel, and you turn over any chance of resistance.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: It's already been done.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I heard about this office. Really is in the basement. I'm here about my mother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, we - we don't know anything more.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I spoke with Dr. Werber. He said you'd been to his office.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he say why?

speaker: SPENDER
line: No. He didn't have to. I'm assuming knowing the facts I do, that you're wondering about the possibility of alien abduction. I'm sure you know enough about it. Agent Mulder surely pushed the idea.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, actually, Agent Mulder hasn't.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I find that hard to believe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought you were here about your mother.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You went to see her. I'd like to know what you talked about.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We talked about how she was feeling. We talked about a lot of things.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You talked about abduction, about her experiences? Did you talk about me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In what way?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I have something here that I think might explain a lot for you.

speaker: YOUNG SPENDER
line: ... and there's a bright light. There's people standing around.

speaker: SPENDER
line: That's me. I'm 11 years old.

speaker: YOUNG SPENDER
line: They're looking up at something in the sky, where the bright light is. I'm starting to cry. I'm really, really scared and I wanna get back in the car, but I can't find my mom. And... then I see her. There's something in the sky, and it's got flashing lights, and it's so bright it hurts my eyes. And then she going up in the sky. And I'm yelling, "Mommy... mommy... mommy..." And then I feel my feet, and they aren't on the ground. I'm floating up.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Seen enough?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is that what you were afraid people would find out?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Yes. But not because it's true. None of this happened.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I made it up. Or I should say, my mom did.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She told you to say those things?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Essentially. She told me that story so many times that I believed it. Absolutely. It became a kind of truth and it was really just a substitute.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what?

speaker: SPENDER
line: For the fact that my dad had left his family and it drove my mom insane. Only, I was eleven years old and I didn't know it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are you here, Agent Spender? Why did you show this to me?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Because I think the process is bogus. Dr. Werber and his whole regression of memory is BS. It's like having a dream and then pretending it's real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think that Dr. Werber would beg to differ.

speaker: SPENDER
line: He indulged and infantilized my mother for his own purposes. I think he's dangerous and I think his methods are unsound, and if you went through it, I hope you'd question what came out of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I appreciate your opinion, agent Spender, but I don't have a mother feeding me abduction stories.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You've got Agent Mulder, don't you? How many times have you heard the stories he's told? How about the one about his own sister?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Don't let yourself be used.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You must be losing it, Mulder. I could beat you with one hand.

speaker: [NOTE
line: Krycek lost his arm in 4X10 Terma.]

speaker: MULDER
line: Isn't that how you like to beat yourself? If those are my last words I can do better.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'm not here to kill you, Mulder. I'm here to help you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, thanks.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You know, if it wasn't in my best interests, I would just as soon squeeze this trigger.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's stopping you?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Hear this, Agent Mulder... listen very carefully because what I'm telling you is deadly serious. There is a war raging, and unless you pull your head out of the sand, you and I and about five billion other people are going to go the way of the dinosaur. I'm talking planned invasion. The colonization of this planet by an extraterrestrial race.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought you were serious.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Kazakhstan, Skyland Mountain, the site in Pennsylvania. They're all alien lighthouses where the colonization will begin, but where now, a battle's being waged. A struggle for heaven and earth.

speaker: MULDER
line: Serve who?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: No, not who. What.

speaker: MULDER
line: Krycek, you're a murderer, a liar and a coward. Just because you stick a gun in my chest, I'm supposed to believe you're my friend?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Get up.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I was sent by a man... a man who knows, as I do, that resistance is in our grasp, and in yours. The mass incinerations were strikes by an alien rebellion to upset plans for occupation. Now, one of these rebels is being held captive. And if he dies, so does the resistance.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <Good luck to you, my friend.>

speaker: MULDER
line: Come in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? What are you doing sitting here in the dark?

speaker: MULDER
line: Thinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thinking about what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, the usual. Destiny, fate, how to throw a curve ball. The inextricable relationships in our lives that are neither accidental nor somehow in our control, either.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I've just taken a long walk and I've reconsidered that I may have been wrong about what I believed happened to me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been doing some reconsidering of my own.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe an answer... to a question you and I seem to have been destined to ask. He walks past her, and she turns to follow.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Yes, sir?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're federal agents requesting permission to enter the base.

speaker: OFFICER
line: You have any paperwork to go with that, Agent Muldar?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's Mulder. I wasn't aware that any special authorization was needed to enter.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Well, due to the nature of our facility and the hazardous chemicals on site, I can only allow precleared civilians and military personnel on base.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you aware there's been a leak and contamination in one of the labs and the personnel on site need immediate medical attention?

speaker: OFFICER
line: No, sir, I wasn't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why don't you go check on that, son? I'd hate for somebody to die because you were uninformed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Buckle up, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he's armed and well within his jurisdiction.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know this man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That driver. I know his face.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: OFFICER
line: Stop that truck!

speaker: OFFICER
line: Get out of the car! You're under arrest. This is west gate. I've got a breach of security and a possible hijacking of a military vehicle. Repeat, this is w -

speaker: MULDER
line: Nooooooooo!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. He covers his face, almost in tears, but she comforts him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Yes, sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm sorry. There's been no news about your mother.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I appreciate your wanting to keep this discreet. I'll try and do that. But you should know Agent Mulder has opened an X-File on this case. This hasn't reflected on you in any way, Agent Spender.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Thank you, sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You'll do fine. It seems you have a patron outside this office who thinks highly of you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Who's that?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know. Someone working with a high level of influence.

speaker: MAIL MAN
line: Oh, Agent Spender. Got a letter for you. R. R. #1 North Hatley, Quebec JOB 2C0 Canada and gives it to Spender.

speaker: BOY
line: Sorry about that, mister.
